definition: comical/funny/amusing/old pr. [gu3 ji1]/huaji, a form of comedy performance popular in Shanghai, Jiangsu and Zhejiang

sentences.english: The professor is really hilarious and funny. He makes it very interesting.
sentences.chinese: 教授真的很搞笑很滑稽，他课讲很有意思。
他滑稽地模仿那个政客的举止。

sentences.english: But the funny thing about reality is that it's always disproving the most logical theories.
sentences.chinese: 但是滑稽的事关于现实是它总是反驳最逻辑的理论。

sentences.english: That's a comical hat you're wearing, with all those flowers!
sentences.chinese: 你正戴着的帽子真滑稽，有那么多花在上面。

sentences.english: The movements he made were so comical that I was hard put to it not to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他作出的动作是如此的滑稽以至于我忍不住大笑。

sentences.english: But I have tried comical and funny roles before.
sentences.chinese: 但我尝试过滑稽诙谐的角色。

sentences.english: The funny runner put the sun-glasses on the gun for fun.
sentences.chinese: 滑稽的赛跑者将太阳镜戴在枪上取乐。

sentences.english: One thing you can say about them is that they are funny.
sentences.chinese: 你们可以说，他们很滑稽。

sentences.english: It's so funny that a tamed panda can even ride a bike.
sentences.chinese: 驯熟的熊猫还会骑自行车呢，真滑稽。

sentences.english: The early movies are funny to us because the players hammed it up.
sentences.chinese: 我们觉得早期的电影很滑稽，因为演员表演太做作了。

sentences.english: There's a history of the underdog using standup comedy to speak truth to power.
sentences.chinese: 向来都有被压迫的人借滑稽说笑向当权者说出真相。

sentences.english: She prefers to play comic roles.
sentences.chinese: 她更喜欢扮演滑稽角色。

sentences.english: The result is often hilarious photos and videos from friends and family.
sentences.chinese: 成果通常是滑稽的照片和亲友们的视频。

sentences.english: His antics and personality brought a certain approachability to a grim subject.
sentences.chinese: 他的滑稽动作和个性带来了一定的可接近到严峻课题。

sentences.english: They spoiled the music just the same, with their antics and unrealities.
sentences.chinese: 他们那些不真实的滑稽表演也一样破坏了音乐。

sentences.english: I know that sounds a little facetious but stress is of the mind.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这听起来很滑稽但是压力的确是由心而生。

definition: cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/between laughter and tears
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
